node.text:
A part of my recent webinar on Sky Events of 2021 for photographers & stargazers, from the series Learning Night Sky Photography Webinars available on babaktafreshi.com/workshop (link in bio).
You can also watch this 16-min video in better quality on my YouTube channel @babaktafreshi

node.text:
Tab on the IGTV icon and rotate phone to watch it full screen. Curiosity is one of the main reasons we are different from other species. Humans explore the universe out of curiosity, not for our immediate physical needs. Our curiosity often changes our world with new technology and a better understanding of nature. Music is "Poem Master" by composer @BarbadBayat, performed by National Symphony Orchestra of Ukraine. 
The night sky is reflected on a 17-meter (56-foot) mirror of the MAGIC telescope (an array of several). It observes gamma rays indirectly (as they are blocked in the atmosphere) by detecting brief flashes of optical light, called Cherenkov light. The timelapse is filmed at the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory on La Palma in the Canary Islands. I visit this dark sky paradise annually for Astromaster photo workshop (next one in October 2021 & May 2022). 
Watch this in 4K on my YouTube channel (Babak Tafreshi) 
#timelapse #science #astronomy #curiosity #babakworkshops @twanight @magictelescopes

node.text:
Tab on the IGTV icon and rotate phone to watch it full screen. An incredible night in Guatemala, in Nov. 2019 with my friend @pinceladasnocturnas. Lightning on the horizon and stars above the erupting Volcan de Fuego (Fire Volcano). The soundtrack “Lava Symphony” is by composer @BarbadBayat, performed by the National Symphony Orchestra of Ukraine.
Watch this in 4K on my YouTube channel (Babak Tafreshi) 
#timelapse #guatemala #volcano #earth #storm

node.text: Today live conversation with International Dark Sky Association @idadarksky about light pollution, how it affects us, and how to reduce it. Also on dark sky places where the natural night environment still exists.

node.text:
Last week, on a midnight of Bryce Canyon National Park, the striking sandstone rock formations embrace darkness as the moon disappears on the other horizon. During the 4 hour timelapse sequence constellation Orion and bright star Sirius dominate the winter sky. Watch this fullscreen with sound to enjoy the original music piece “Raindrops” by composer @barbadbayat, a part of our growing collaboration. 
#timelapse #brycecanyon #utah #moonlight #earth @twanight

node.text:
Sound on and enjoy this new released project. The original music piece Celestial by @barbadbayat, performed by Prague Metropolitan Orchestra, along with this rare conjunction of bright planets Venus and Jupiter, with the Lagoon Nebula (far in the Galaxy), above volcanoes and tropical clouds, filmed from Lake Atitlan, Guatemala, November 2019. 
We started the project with writing the music inspired by my work, arranging the 70-piece orchestra, and studio recording in February but the pandemic delayed the release of the first video to now. More to come this year. Studio videos by @amiralivafaei. Watch in better resolution on YouTube.com/babaktafreshi

The live on 2020 June 7 on night sky photography, your most frequent questions, my new book, The World at Night (TWAN) international project with guest appearances of @twanight members @jeffdaiphoto China, @los_cielos_de_america France/Germany, @miguel_claro Portugal, @yuribeletsky Chile, @ytakasaka Canada
#twanight #theworldatnight #astrophotography #nightphotography

node.text:
The scene of last evening May 8th near Boston. Sound on and enjoy this 2-minute relaxing and wondrous video of the Full Moon rising above the Atlantic Ocean and a carrier ship (the video’s end) as the Earth atmosphere refracts the moonlight and creates mirages and bizarre shapes of the lunar face. I used a long telephoto lens for this closeup view. The video is 2x faster than real-time. 
This beautiful piano piece “I Witness Windflaw” is written & performed by my friend @BarbadBayat. 
See the video in the original format and better quality on YouTube.com/babaktafreshi
#fullmoon #moonrise #atmospheric #astrophotography

node.text:
Sound on & Tab on IGTV icon to watch it full screen.
ALMA radio telescopes listening to the universe. One of the world's highest and most complex observatories with an array of 66 dishes located 5000 meters high in northern Chile. Original soundtrack: Symphonic Poems by composer @barbadbayat, performed by the National Symphony Orchestra of Ukraine. See the video in better quality on
Vimeo.com/btafreshi
YouTube.com/babaktafreshi

node.text:
The moonrise of last night near Boston, just before the tropical storm Henri reaches here. Celestial scenes purify my mind and bring me an eternal peace. It’s a pity this view doesn’t heal the brainwashed young fighters of Taliban, neither helped those who served for Nazis. For 10 days I did not post on Instagram. It didn’t feel right to post anything, considering what happens in Afghanistan. Meanwhile the Delta variant outbreak in my birth country Iran is taking a thousand lives per day, following the deadly decision of the religious leaders who banned importing American and British vaccines months ago, claiming that microchips are hidden inside. They lifted the ban last week when the nation was exploding from suffer. People of Iran are still desperately looking for vaccines. Only 5% of the population is fully vaccinated. A few afforded to travel to nearby countries to get vaccinated or pay the untrustworthy black market for almost $500 per dose. A petition is started by @vaccineforiran and your signature may help to inquire international support from @who @gavialliance. 
Watch Shoreline Moonrise video in better quality on my YouTube channel. The music is by composer @barbadbayat through our growing collaboration.

node.text:
Last night in Sierra Nevada, on a photo workshop in California, while watching bright and long meteor streaks across the sky, this one was very surprisngly captured through a 200mm telephoto lens, aimed to the rugged Sierra peaks and the brightest part of the Milky Way, the galactic core. The single exposure photograph of 8 seconds at f2 and high ISO, was made using a star tracking mount to avoid statrtrails due to the Earth rotation. Therefore the mountains are slightly blurred (if you zoom in) due to the tracker motion. This surreal view shows far beyond our naked eyes limit, with fine details of dark dust clouds in the galaxy and the M6 star cluster in constellation Scorpius, also known as the Butterfly cluster (to the right of meteor’s head). 
The peak of Perseid meteor shower is on August 12. Read my previous post for details on when to see this. For print inquiries of this piece please message. #meteor #meteorshower #perseids #sierra @twanight

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Babak Tafreshi on August 08, 2021. May be an image of tree, nature and sky.

node.text:
The Perseid meteor shower is about to reach the peak, on August 12. The moon is absent and away from light pollution you may see up to 100 meteors per hour at the peak hours. The peak is around 20:30 UT which means in the Americas the early morning of the 12th is slightly preferred (specially in Western Americas) while in the rest of the world the peaks is from midnight to morning of the 13th. This meteor shower is slightly favored for northern hemisphere. Meteor rate increases after midnight when the shower’s radiant in constellation Perseus rises. Meteors don’t necessarily appear near the radiant. They can be anywhere in the sky. In the cities you will see far less meteors due to light pollution and skyglow but still the brighter ones will be strikingly beautiful. 
About the image: A colorful Perseid fireball in early morning, above an apple tree which is lit by an LED panel, In 2012.
 #meteorshower #perseids @twanight

node.text: A starry midnight of Sierra Nevada. In this single-exposure photograph of 10 seconds the moon was rising behind me, shining on the mountains while the Milky Way was still visible in the transparent sky of this high altitude lake. See a closer crop of the reflections in the second slide. Scattered light in the reflections show the star colors better. I look forward to return to here next week under dark skies for the Perseid Meteor Shower (Aug 12) and our annual California Nightscape workshop with @mikeshawphotography. Learn more on babaktafreshi.com/ca21 or tap the link my bio

node.text: It’s incredible how these tiny space pebbles create such a brilliant display, some 100 km (60 mi) above us, as they crash into Earth atmosphere. These are recorded at high ISO on real-time video using @sigmaphoto fp camera and the 35mm f1.2 lens. Enjoy the next Perseid meteor shower on August 12. This year the moon is absent. Away from light pollution you may see up to 100 meteors per hour at the peak time. #sigma35mmf12art #sigmafp #meteorshower #perseids

node.text:
One planet, one family of humanity. A symbolic beautiful dream. This pandemic showed it is still far behind walls of inequality, abuse of power, tribal politics, and the mankind will to collect wealth. 
I’m not a medical expert nor a politician but the numbers are clear. Normal life is returning to the US and more of the world thanks to the vaccines and the people & leaders who believed in science. But in low-income countries only 1% of population on average have received a dose of COVID vaccine. A dose costs $2-5 in the developed world. It seems that any nation can afford it but its administration is far more costly, specially in developing world. Many nations do not afford it. Some others may loose time and resources with corrupted leaders who take their entire nation as hostages in a deadly environment. 
I have lost a friend in my birth-country Iran, every month in the pandemic. Iran is not a poor country, even with all the ongoing sanctions. But the resources are controlled by the small conservative minority and the priority is clearly not saving lives. Iran is the 30th in the list of national net wealth but in the vaccine distribution is near the bottom. Iranian officials could buy vaccines for the nation of 83 million with only 5% of the defense budget or just one week worth of the nuclear power investment (estimated $34 billion for this year). Despite excellent medical teams across the country who saved many lives, the close relationship with China and poor leadership, made Iran one of the earliest and most affected countries in the pandemic. 
The Islamic Republic leaders claimed microchips are inside the vaccines, an idea that was initially spread by the head of the Russian Communist party in May 2020. The officials promised Iranian made vaccines which 5 of them are proudly announced on the state-run media, none approved yet by @who and none are widely available to public. You may find this situation similar to your own country. A lot of challenges for #equality on this planet. 
To help sending vaccines to the world please donate to COVAX program at Vaccine Alliance (gavi.org) and UNICEF (unicef.org). Earth at night video is by @nasaearth

node.text:
A crystal clear night began with moonlight on Himalayas in the World Heritage Sagarmatha National Park of Nepal. It was November 2009 and I was documenting Nepal at night with my colleague @oshinzak for The World at Night project @twanight. After a long hopeless hike in the fog we reached this iconic vista at 3600 meters near Namche Bazar on the trail to Everest base camp, where we were standing above the clouds. Spectacular view of Himalayas emerged under stunningly starry sky. On the left stars of Auriga rise over Mt. Everest. Lhotse (the world's 4th highest at 8516 meters) is in the middle and the outstanding Ama Dablam (6812 m) is on the right, where the Pleiades star cluster is rising. A Buddhist stupa is also visible in the foreground. The light in the valley is from the Tengboche Monastery, a religious center for Sherpa community at about 4000 meters high. Sagarmatha is a Sanskrit word meaning the head in the sky. The national park’s highest point is 8848 m at the summit of Everest. 
The soundtrack “Om Mani Padme Hum” is from Tibetan Incantations by Simon Brown (1998). Swipe to see more images. The panorama “The Roof of The World” and more Himalaya photos are available in my fine art catalog. Tap the link in bio to explore more. #twanight #nepal #himalaya #earth

node.text:
Every few years a bright comet appears in the Earth sky, a wandering body of ice from outer Solar System. Last July Comet NEOWISE became a true spectacle to the camera, in the northern hemisphere. Here, far from city lights at this lake near White Mountains in New Hampshire, the comet tail was visible to naked eye in evening twilight but fainter than what you see in this single-exposure photograph of 5 seconds through a telephoto lens. Swipe for a timelapse video of the scene.
The next interesting comet could come in December when the recently found Comet Leonard may reach naked-eye visibility. I will update you here. 
The image “Comet at Dusk” is an available panoramic piece in my fine art catalog. Tap the link in the bio. 
#sigma135mmart #canoneosra #twanight #comet @sigmaphoto @twanight

node.text:
Some of the most enjoyable nights in my life have been stargazing with people from all around the world. Sharing our interest to nature and outer universe and forgetting our concerns and daily life stress. It’s a unique experience and if you are around New England on Aug 28-Sep 1 join me in Maine Stargazing & Photography Retreat. 
Tap the link in my bio or visit babaktafreshi.com/maine 
The 4-night all-inclusive retreat includes workshops for both hobby and pro photographers, lessons under stars and stargazing with our telescopes, day-time lectures by myself and other invited speakers, nature walks and kayaking, hosted in the wonderful @medomakcamp, about 3 hours drive north of Boston. The site, next to a beautiful lake, has one of the darkest skies in the Northeast and they actively preserve dark skies in the area. Some of the images in this set are made at another stargazing annual event in this site. 
Pic 1: a single exposure of 45 minutes reveals earth rotation as startrails around Polaris and the moving red lights of stargazers.
Pic 2: group photo of a Maine Astronomy Retreat in 2016
Pic 3: a house across the lake and one of the many workshop imaging locations near us 
Pic 4: the summer milky way from the site 
Pic 5: Astrophotographer and avid stargazer Bruce Berger is the program’s co-organizer 
Pic 6: a self portrait while using a telephoto lens for deep sky photography 
Pic 7: Lake Washington, next to the site, is an attractive imaging location 
Pic 8: stars appears after a quick summer lightning storm in the evening 
Pic 9: boats and Kayaks for daytime activities 
Pic 10: educational lectures in day-time and also in any cloudy night 
@twanight #babakworkshops #stargazing #astrophotography #maine #newengland

node.text:
In a winter afternoon near Cedar Breaks National monument, the first quarter moon rises above cedar trees and striking rock formations in Blowhard Mountain, a popular hiking destination. The 3rd photo is behind-the-scene by my colleague and long-time friend @oshinzak. After a NatGeo project in Utah, I joined Oshin one a visit to some of the region’s landmarks. While on the road passing this impressive mountain I realized the moon will  soon rise above it in daytime.
This piece, “Cedar Moonrise”, is added to the fine art print catalog (tap the link in bio). 
#moon #utah #cedarbreaks
